org.wonderly.jini.serviceui
Class PropertyAdminDelegate

java.lang.Object
  org.wonderly.jini.serviceui.PropertyAdminDelegate
Direct Known Subclasses:
PropertyAdminDelegate
public abstract class PropertyAdminDelegate
extends Object

Property setting via remote method calls that use introspection would require the class hierachy of the existing service to be altered, without some form of delegation. We have the methods for setting and clearing properties to be managed via a simple interface (PropertiesAccess).

This class should be subclassed, and its abstract methods implemented to provide debugging and logging facilities specific to the application.

The service should implement PropertiesAccess, and then delegate those calls to its implementatio of this class. It should pass itself as the argument to the calls, or the approriate object that provides the properties for the application.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Gregg Wonderly - gregg.wonderly@pobox.com

getPropertiesForObject

public Properties getPropertiesForObject(Object cls,
                                         boolean defer)
                                  throws IntrospectionException,
                                         RemoteException,
                                         InvocationTargetException,
                                         IllegalAccessException
This method uses introspection to find the properties for the passed object and turn them into a Properties object.

Parameters:
cls - the object to get the properties for
defer - true to defer to a PropertyValueManager implementation
Throws:
IntrospectionException - if there are problems accessing the object
InvocationTargetException - if the property reader can not be invoked
IllegalAccessException - if the object is not accessible,
RemoteException
See Also:
setViaReflection(java.lang.Object, java.util.Properties)

PropertyVetoException
InvocationTargetException
IllegalAccessException

setViaReflection

public void setViaReflection(Object cls,
                             Properties props)
                      throws IntrospectionException,
                             PropertyVetoException,
                             InvocationTargetException,
                             IllegalAccessException
This method takes the passed object and a set of properties and uses reflection to set the property values for the object to the values inside the property object.

Parameters:
cls - an object to set properties on
props - the property values to set on cls.
Throws:
IntrospectionException - if an error occurs during introspection.
PropertyVetoException - if a boolean property value is not one of (0,1,"yes","no","true","false")
InvocationTargetException - if there is a problem invoking the property setting method.
IllegalAccessException - if the property setting method can not be accessed.
See Also:
getPropertiesForObject(java.lang.Object, boolean)
